task.title: Adding a Registry to the Web Services Explorer

titlealts.searchtitle: Adding a Registry to the Web Services Explorer

task.shortdesc: Although the Web Services Explorer comes populated with several registries, you can also add additional registries to your list of favorites.

prereq.p:
Prerequisites:
Register with a registry
Launch the Web Services Explorer

context.p: When you are ready to publish your business entity and Web service, add a production registry to the Web Services Explorer. In order to publish your business entity and Web service to a production registry, you must first register with the registry. The registry will provide instructions for registering. For more information on registries, refer to Registering with a registry.
The UDDI Business Registry is a set of global replicated registries. For a list of public registries refer to www.uddi.org/register.html
The IBM UDDI Business Registry is a public production registry maintained by IBM. For more information on the IBM UDDI Business Registry refer to http://uddi.ibm.com

step.cmd: To add a Registry to the Web Services Explorer from Favorites, do the following:

substep.cmd: Click the Favorites icon in the main toolbar.

Select a registry then click the Add to UDDI Page icon
in the Actions pane.

step.cmd: To add a Registry to the Web Services Explorer manually, do the following:

substep.cmd: In the UDDI Navigator pane, click the UDDI Main node.
In the Actions pane, enter the Registry name and Inquiry URL of the registry you want to add.
